description: Haunted by stories of BCI abuses during the mural unrest, Oksana Lintz privately resolves to act after hearing firsthand the cost of wrongful erasures.
Oksana uses her Directorate analyst clearance to transfer 'The Ledger'—a secret archive of BCI errors and disappearances—to a trusted Innovator news group, bypassing official protocols.
The Innovator-aligned news group publicly releases 'The Ledger,' exposing widespread BCI injustices since 2022. Citizens learn of thousands of wrongful sanctions, fueling outrage and protests.
Citizens gather at the mural site, sharing testimonies of BCI abuse. The movement gains momentum as victims are recognized; public confidence in the Council collapses.
Council factions fight over BCI’s future. Directorate demands suppression; Innovators and Harmonists debate reform or abolition in newly public sessions as trust in algorithms erodes.
